byline.original: By N. GREGORY MANKIW and LAWRENCE H. SUMMERS

abstract: Economic View column; the Upshot; Cadillac tax on expansive health insurance plans would remove incentive for employers to pay workers in health care, which drives up costs; resulting wage increases could be significant, with $45 billion potential in take-home pay by 2025.
lead_paragraph: A tax on expansive health plans would remove an incentive for employers to pay wages in the form of insurance. That could benefit the system over all.

headline.main: Uniting Behind the Divisive ‘Cadillac’ Tax on Health Plans
headline.print_headline: Uniting Behind a Divisive Health Tax

snippet: A tax on expansive health plans would remove an incentive for employers to pay wages in the form of insurance. That could benefit the system over all.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
